intro: Paradrymonia fuquaiana, commonly known as Fuqua’s paradrymonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors and swampy areas. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth surface and are arranged alternately along the stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
